GdvrH3IwhHD1AVFzglcp9w.text: There's not many places open for breakfast at 8am in Novena, particularly places that accept credit cards. I was running low on data on my international roaming, so I did the unthinkable and went to a cafe without checking it out on Yelp first. Luckily when I connected to the Wi-Fi at Old Town White Coffee, Yelp told me I made a good choice. The Wi-Fi is fast and free - hurrah.My Singaporean friend tells me this is a Malaysian chain of cafes. I opted for the kaya toast which comes with soft boiled (extremely soft) eggs, and toast with your choice of kaya or peanut butter for $7. I got some hot teh and was set up for a hearty breakfast. Service was friendly, and the food came out reasonably quickly. Definitely one to stop in at if you need an early breakfast and you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Old Town White Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Kaya toast
Photo of Old Town White Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Kaya toast
Photo of Old Town White Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Hot teh

hXtBsPKxTOk2E2ADbmw2-A.text: Old Town White Coffee...I went here coz you are a Halal Certified establishment.  That ALONE is an added bonus in my books.My 2nd trip here.  Last year was with my Cousin In Law and our good friend for Late Breakfast and Early Lunch on a PUBLIC Holiday aka National Day.This time around it was on Tuesday for Lunch.  Time was about 12:15hrs ish.  Thankfully I managed to get seats.  This time around it was outside aka "patio" aka along the walk way of the Mall etc.My mother opt for the Fish Ball Noodle Soup and we shared the Fried Wantons Dumplings.  I like the Fried Wantons Dumplings coz its FRIED to order and comes out HOT!  As for beverages I opt for the Ice Chendol.  Our Lunch or I would say, my Dining experience here is doable.  None of the items I had stood out.  Disappointing dish or I would say the Beverage aka Ice Chendol I had.  Too diluted and the chendol DO NOT taste authentic chedol at all for my personal taste bud.  Perhaps they get their chendol factory made.Especially during Public Holiday, do plan to arrive early if you want to dine in.  This establishment tends to be packed to the brim.  This is also my observation during LUNCH hour on a Weekday.  *SIGH*You pay your order inside at the counter.  The staffs are so-so.  NOT the friendly or accommodating type.  *DOUBLE SIGH*May return BUT NOT in a hurry.  Hence this GENEROUS 3 stars review.  Actually its ALMOST 2.5 stars at best!

photos.caption: Photo of Old Town White Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Pardon of the blurry picture.  Fried Wontons up close
Photo of Old Town White Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Fried Wanton Dumplings
Photo of Old Town White Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. Fish Ball Noodle Soup with Mee as our option.

hq0iBo-TpAgUKz_vPHofvw.text: I vote this as the rudest Restaurant in Singapore. Food is on par or less with cheaper hawker center. Absolutely not worth it. Typical franchise junk

Af9ITWJ2EPa3msU2rv349Q.text: Always a good place for a Malaysian food fix specifically ipoh food since this chain is from up north! The ipoh hor fun is always reliably good but so is most everything else. The coffee is also hits the spot. This place is a great place for a take out but can get quite packed during mealtimes.

photos.caption: Photo of Old Town White Coffee - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Old Town White Coffee - Singapore, Singapore

_8YpjBWYgGUWzwu9G14fEQ.text: I tend to be quite generous with my stars, but I really can't bring myself to give this place any more than I have. Bad service, slow service, and very irritatingly, you have to ring a bell for service. And considering how bad and slow service was, that Bell was ringing incessantly. And I don't mean by me, it's one Bell that keeps ringing regardless who presses it. For a place with 'coffee' in its name, you'd expect it to have good coffee. But no, what they have is almost like the instant machine type you get from vending machines. Not something freshly brewed. The Javanese noodles I had wasn't too bad, but for what you pay, I'll look for something else next time.

navhxmyZh0MaefZWQaYJkg.text: It took me a while to warm up to the Old Town White Coffee chain. I didn't know much about it, no one ever recommended that I go there, and with it's presence all over the place I thought it would just offer sub par food.The first time my husband and I tried Old Town was actually in Malaysia. We took a weekend trip to Penang. It was a Sunday and a lot of the hawkers were closed. Long story short, we were touring the area with a rickshaw driver and got extremely hungry. Our knowledgable driver spoke highly of this place and recommended that we eat there.I forgot what we ordered, but we were impressed! And the prices were affordable! So when we came back to SG, we knew we should visit again.Luckily, this outlet near our place satisfies our craving each time. Our favorites are the curry chicken dish (which they say isn't spicy but trust me, it has a decent kick to it) and the BBQ chicken noodles. I fell in love with chendul in Penang, and they do offer it here, so one day I hope to give it a try.If we're not in the mood to eat outside or to walk to our favorite hawker, we always end up here. The comfortable environment and affordable prices make my husband and I huge fans. Watch out, Nik T- your dukedom here is in danger!! ;)

_Wo0Hzm790ifiVFw5EncFA.text: waitress: xi mut milk tea?me: yes, please!m: xi mut milk tea???w: yes, it is!!!unconvinced, i took a sniff!xi mut milk tea it was!!wow, the colour of their tea is indeed power!!!so much so i mistook it for coffee, my bad.xi mut means silk stockings.someone in malaysia must have been desperate and used his wife's silk stockings when he ran out of the good old coffee sock!hopefully it was a brand new pair and not otherwise.anyway, that is my version of how it started.if you are in a rush, this is not the place for you.at old town, their philosophy is to take life at a leisurely pace.they take their time and recommends that you do the same.so if you wanna lepak, then this is the place to be.even their soft boil eggs take 8 mins to be ready!:)be patient, says the aunty.as long as it comes out perfect, says me!the accompanying dark sauce is of the thick consistency type, which is good.their coffee has a good head to it, ala teh tarik.their curry mee which i asked, and they accommodated, to be replace with their ipoh hor fun was yums!a lot more ingredients than i remember it back when i patronized their outlet in bukit timah.bean sprouts, long beans, fish cake, chicken, char siu chicken, tau pok, and bean curd skin.curry was lemak and not too spicy.hor fun was smooth as silk(not stockings).kiss 92 fm was playing in the background.nostalgic indeed.free wifi is available in the form of old town white coffee, wireless@sg or from tully's coffee opposite.

photos.caption: Photo of Old Town White Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. floor tiles.
Photo of Old Town White Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. the kitchen.
Photo of Old Town White Coffee - Singapore, Singapore. soft boil eggs with black sauce.

OBe4x0NrHS6ywjuLEl5ONg.text: Stayed at a nearby hotel. Needed coffee and a light breakfast in the morning. Walked in to Old Town just because it was the first place I saw. My life was improved!I dont even like coffee but they had a lot of good choices and the coffee was GOOD. Breakfast was small but tastey and cheap. Kaya butter & toast was on the next level of flavor. Do yourself a favor and skip starbucks next time.

qzhbOxmJ35LyjIuxII1LKw.text: think they deserve 0 starservice is very very slow,and the person taking the order seem unsure about the menuand the cashier is a waiter cum a serverfood ready but no one to serveand they take more than 30min to serve our orders when the cafe is not even busyand worst of all, they miss out one of our order and when we ask them, the staff did not even bother to check with kitchen and straight away tell me dun have!! damn lousy serviceeven if you give me $1000, i dun think i want to come here and suffer and have lousy experience!

aoo8qLJgXL6QnxQ7Lou6xQ.text: first time here. tried the nasi lemak and asam laksa. I like the nasi lemak, the asam laksa gravy is a little thick. I like the penang type of soury laksa better.
